description: Triangle T(n,k): T(n,k) = phi(k) if k divides n, T(n,k)=0 otherwise (n >= 1, 1<=k<=n). T(n,k) = number of elements of order k in cyclic group of order n.
links: Reinhard Zumkeller, Rows n=1..100 of triangle, flattened
R. J. Mathar, Plots of cycle graphs of the finite groups up to order 36, (2015)
formula: Sum (T(n,k): k = 1 .. n) = n. [_Reinhard Zumkeller_, Oct 18 2011]
